alert.note: Alert for Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 09 at 6:52PM MST until January 09 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Utah County in northern Utah... * Until 730 PM MST. * At 651 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Draper, or near Sandy, moving south at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 253 and 283. US Route 6 between mile markers 174 and 177. Locations impacted include... Provo, Orem, Lehi, Spanish Fork, Pleasant Grove, Springville, American Fork, Eagle Mountain, Lindon, Alpine, Mapleton, Salem, Cedar Fort, Vineyard, Brigham Young University, Palmyra, Lake Shore, Benjamin, Utah Lake, and West Mountain. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
